page.title: 05The Lakeside Country Club
page.content: The{Lakeside Country Club}was built in 1973 as a leisure centre to attract people from different countries. Five years later there was a tragic fire which burnt the Entertainment Centre and Restaurant to the ground. The new Country Club was bigger and better than the one before and now includes a leisure club and hotel with a hairdressing salon. The area covers 65 acres including a lake and some woodland. Waterfowl live by the lake, incuding an unpopular heron which eats the fish. Facilities include tennis, squash, trout fishing and windsurfing. The owner of{Lakeside}thought it a good idea to have such a complex where people could find first class entertainment without going to London 45km away.{Lakeside}is the largest entertainment centre in Britain.
